definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Imagine a tick-tack-toe grid in your viewfinder.
sentences.chinese: 想象取景器中一點一點移動的柵格。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, Seret had inched along the car toward Stephen.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，塞裏特沿着汽車一點一點地靠近了史蒂芬。

sentences.english: The case was uncovered, little by little, by the finding of clues.
sentences.chinese: 這個案子是根據線索一點一點地捯出來的。

sentences.english: The fish then went to work, nibbling away.
sentences.chinese: 然後魚去工作，一點一點地輕咬腳趾和小腿。

sentences.english: Rahul resumes grinding away at the dry earth with the spade.
sentences.chinese: 拉胡爾重又開始用鐵鍬一點一點颳去乾硬的土壤。

sentences.english: Bit by bit I put Master in the bag.
sentences.chinese: 我一點一點地將師父裝進了我的錢包。

sentences.english: These disruptions meant that the divisions arrived at the railhead in Kharkov in dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 師屬部隊分散的在哈爾科夫的車站一點一點地卸載。

sentences.english: Wu month he save from the darkness bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 伍月把他一點一點地從黑暗中挽救出來。

sentences.english: We manage to pump the whole story out of him little by little.
sentences.chinese: 我們設法一點一點地從他那裏探出事情的全過程。

sentences.english: The railway station clock ticked away the hours of waiting.
sentences.chinese: 火車站的時鐘滴答作響，等候的時間在一點一點過去。

sentences.english: I myself have become a Gaullist only little by little.
sentences.chinese: 我本身也只是一點一點地才成爲一個戴高樂主義者的。

sentences.english: Sitting quietly by the window watching things get wet.
sentences.chinese: 安靜地坐在窗邊，看萬物是如何被雨一點一點潤溼的。

sentences.english: Pianezzi has slowly introduced his alpaca, a domesticated animal from the Andean highlands, to the water over the past several months.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的幾個月裏，多明戈一點一點地教羊駝下水。

sentences.english: The mouse nibbled at the peanuts.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠一點一點地啃着花生。

sentences.english: Aren't you hungary? You are onl. y nibbling your food.
sentences.chinese: 你餓嗎？你只不過是在一點一點咬你的食物。

sentences.english: The colour of the table cloth will fade away little by little.
sentences.chinese: 這桌布的顏色會一點一點褪掉的。

definition: one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
wordless and uncommunicative (idiom); without speaking/taciturn/not providing any news
to expend a great deal of effort
